subsections.title: Packet Basics
subsections.label: subsec:packet-basics
prompts: Explain the concept of packet radio, including its purpose and how it differs from other digital communication modes.
Describe the role of error detection in packet radio transmissions, including the use of checksums.
Discuss the automatic repeat request (ARQ) mechanism in packet radio and how it ensures reliable communication.
Clarify the relationship between Morse code (CW) and packet radio, if any, and explain why Morse code is considered a digital mode.

subsections.title: APRS
subsections.label: subsec:aprs2
prompts: Explain the purpose and functionality of APRS (Automatic Packet Reporting System) in amateur radio.
Describe the types of data that can be transmitted via APRS, including GPS position data, text messages, and weather data.
Discuss the real-time tactical communication applications of APRS, particularly in conjunction with map-based station location tracking.

subsections.title: DMR Talkgroups
subsections.label: subsec:dmr-talkgroups2

Describe the time-multiplexing technique used in DMR to transmit two digital voice signals on a single 12.5 kHz repeater channel.
Discuss the advantages of DMR talkgroups for group communication and how they reduce interference from other users.
